data.title: OnSceneSet()
data.body:
This is a refactoring which creates a new virtual function to Component: OnSceneSet(). This allows components such as drawables to be created outside a scene, to be moved into a scene later, or to be moved into another scene. It should also fix  #748.

Testing would be appreciated. Some things will not work 100%, for example if a RigidBody exists outside the scene and you set its linear velocity, it has nowhere to store it as the Bullet object does not exist yet.

data.title: Fix Shader
data.body:
Sorry for my english

I suggest a couple of fixes for the shaders are used in his Fork Urho3. All are written in HLSL (but can be transferred to GLSL).

1) Scale Normal
It gives a very clear grain.

Samplers.hlsl
# ifdef PACKEDNORMAL

float3 DecodeNormal (float4 normalInput, float bumpScale)
{
     float3 normal;
     normal.xy = (normalInput.ag \* 2.0 - 1.0);
normal.xy \* = bumpScale;
     normal.z = sqrt (1.0 - saturate (dot (normal.xy, normal.xy)));
     return normal;
}
# endif

Changing bumpScale get different effects.
bumpScale = 1: default
![test 2015-06-30 15-50-35-74](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2390773/8424636/57014cce-1f40-11e5-998f-632d025772fa.png)

bumpScale = 50:
![test 2015-06-30 15-50-18-18](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2390773/8424641/5fcac010-1f40-11e5-8f35-292188c96fd0.png)

2) LitSolid.hlsl
Instead
# ifdef ALPHAMASK

if (diffInput.a <0.5)
discard;
# endif

write:
# ifdef ALPHAMASK

clip (diffInput.a - cCutoff);
# endif

cCutoff - constant

removed superfluous condition. plus the ability to adjust the alfamask
sCutoff 0.0 (nothing is discarded) to 1.1 (drop all)
sCutoff = 0.5 - discarded alpha <0.5

data.title: [Editor] Lua numbers loosing precision after assigning
data.body:
I'll illustrate the issue with a small example. Consider the following lua snippet in a ScriptObject that's attached to a scene node. 

function MyScript:ApplyAttributes() 
    --point_A_noideid is the node id for a node in the scene
    point_A = self.node:GetScene():GetNode(self.point_A_nodeid)
    print(self.point_A_nodeid)
    print(point_A)
end

When assigning the node id to 16777226, saving the scene and restaring, the printed value for self.point_A_nodeid is 16777200 instead (those numbers are just an example, the ones just giving me trouble actually).

Even though lua uses doubles for its internal representation to numbers, that's only half the problem. The real issue seems to be with how the editor is storing those values (which I'm guessing could be a 32 bit float?). Let me explain a bit further:

When loading the scene the following output appears in the console:

```
16777200 
nil
```

Also, the value displayed in the input field for the node id is 1.67772e+07.

But now comes the interesting part. If I manually drag and drop a node to the input field, the value 16777226 (the intended one) appears in the field, and the console shows:

```
16777226
userdata: 0x4011cbe0
```

If after that I close the scene, or just select another node in the hierarchy, the value is changed and the last two digits are lost, making the value nil in the process.

I think this is an editor bug, because information is lost somehow when de-selecting a scene node.

data.title: Refactor build system to support both PCH and non-PCH build
data.body: A new build option called "URHO3D_PCH" will be added. Defaulted to 1. When working with compiler that does not support PCH, the PCH build support can be disabled by setting this build option to 0.

data.title: Create build rule to watch source tree for new source files creation and existing source file deletion
data.body: The new build rule when triggered should rerun CMake to perform build tree reconfiguration to reflect the changes done in the source tree. As this may require underlying Operating-System feature, the new rule may not be possible for all the build/host systems.

data.title: Inclusion conventions - match real filepaths?
data.body:
Now, I have Urho3D building perfectly fine, no issues - but my project which uses it has issues with some of the inclusion layouts. As an example, my engine library indirectly includes inputevents.h, which has:

```
#include <SDL/SDL_joystick.h>
#include <SDL/SDL_gamecontroller.h>
// ... etc.
```

The trouble is, the folder layout is as such:

```
ThirdParty\SDL\include\xxx.h
```

There's also Connection.h, which has `<kNet/kNetFwd.h>` : `kNet/include/kNetFwd.h` - and `<kNet/SharedPtr.h>` : `kNet/include/kNet/SharedPtr.h` as an additional example. No doubt there's many others.
Because I'm using Visual Studio (linux ports kept in consideration), I'm unable to specify an 'additional include directory' because the folder path doesn't match a possible inclusion format. I see a couple of options, both with obvious drawbacks:
- Adjust all the source includes to specify `<SDL_xxx.h>`
- symlink the headers inside the parent folder, so `<SDL/xxx.h>` resolves properly

Are there any plans to change the third-party inclusion names? I don't recall having this problem with 1.32, but have been away from it for a few months! I don't use CMake (I prefer to design the project files for Windows + Linux by hand, so I can learn the systems, and have non-hardcoded design), so for Visual Studio I specify my project paths inside property sheets like the below image, which enables me to switch/upgrade versions with one simple change:

![propsheet](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7099124/8361094/ee322f60-1b25-11e5-9bd5-8b5bed0c20e0.png)

data.title: (feature request) Pls add new Event
Removing child node from scene does not remove drawables, if node is still alive post removal
Linking from an external project on Linux seems to be broken
data.body:
This happens when I try to build using a system quite like is described here: http://urho3d.github.io/documentation/HEAD/_using_library.html

```
-- URHO3D_HOME="/home/celeron55/softat/Urho3D"
CMake Error at /home/celeron55/softat/Urho3D/CMake/Modules/FindUrho3D.cmake:143 (message):
  Could not find Urho3D library in Urho3D build tree or SDK installation.
  Use URHO3D_HOME environment variable or build option to specify the
  location of the build tree or SDK installation.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:35 (find_package)


-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
See also "/home/celeron55/softat/uternadim/Build/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log".
```

I am using CMake 2.8.12.2 and an out-of-source build for both Urho3D and my own project which links to Urho3D.

It seems to be a simple issue of just not enough path and a wrong file to search being given to CMake. I was able to fix it like this:

```
diff --git a/CMake/Modules/FindUrho3D.cmake b/CMake/Modules/FindUrho3D.cmake
index e84d1f9..63a6ec2 100644
--- a/CMake/Modules/FindUrho3D.cmake
+++ b/CMake/Modules/FindUrho3D.cmake
@@ -77,6 +77,8 @@ else ()
     # URHO3D_HOME variable should be an absolute path, so use a non-rooted search even when we are cross-compiling
     if (URHO3D_HOME)
         list (APPEND CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH ${URHO3D_HOME})
+        list (APPEND CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH ${URHO3D_HOME}/Source)
+        list (APPEND CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH ${URHO3D_HOME}/Lib)
         set (SEARCH_OPT NO_CMAKE_FIND_ROOT_PATH)
     endif ()
     # For Android platform, search in path similar to ANDROID_LIBRARY_OUTPUT_PATH variable
@@ -94,7 +96,7 @@ else ()
         # For 64-bit, force to search in 'lib64' path even when the Windows platform is not defaulted to use it
         set_property (GLOBAL PROPERTY FIND_LIBRARY_USE_LIB64_PATHS TRUE)
     endif ()
-    find_path (URHO3D_INCLUDE_DIRS Urho3D.h PATH_SUFFIXES ${PATH_SUFFIX} ${SEARCH_OPT})
+    find_path (URHO3D_INCLUDE_DIRS Urho3D.h Urho3D.pc.in PATH_SUFFIXES ${PATH_SUFFIX} ${SEARCH_OPT})
     find_library (URHO3D_LIBRARIES NAMES Urho3D ${URHO3D_LIB_SEARCH_HINT} PATH_SUFFIXES ${PATH_SUFFIX} ${SEARCH_OPT})
     if (WIN32)
         # For Windows platform, give a second chance to search for a debug version of the library
```

data.title: Allow ray queries to return UV texture coordinates of ray intersection
data.body:
This change adds a new RayQueryLevel - `RAY_TRIANGLE_UV`
This will ask the query to return texture UV coordinates at Ray-Geometry intersection point.

Since this change is mostly geared towards integrating external UI toolkits, I've only implemented this functionality for StaticModel. _(And frankly doing it for AnimatedModels would be pretty resource intensive)_

This feature will allow us to render UI into textures, place them on the game world objects and properly translate and forward mouse/touch event coordinates to the external UI library.

I've also added a small change to Decals sample to exemplify the usage of this feature.

data.title: Add `luaL_loadfile` support, with CMake option to prefer this strategy
data.body:
- Added `LuaScript::LoadRawFile` and `LuaScript::ExecuteRawFile` to load
  files using `luaL_loadfile` rather than via the resource cache
  (`luaL_loadbuffer`).  This strategy makes the source available to Lua
  debuggers (e.g. eclipse LDT) for setting breakpoints, etc.
- Added a CMake option `URHO3D_LUA_RAW_SCRIPT_LOADER` to make
  `luaL_loadfile` the default script loading strategy.
  - `LuaScript::ExecuteFile` will thus prefer the `luaL_loadfile`
    strategy, aiding in debugging as above, but without needing to change
    method calls.
  -  `LuaScript::Loader` will also prefer the `luaL_loadfile` strategy,
    so that scripts `require`d in the main script are also amenable to
    debugging.
  - If a script file cannot be loaded from the file system, then it will
    fall back on the default resource cache `luaL_loadbuffer` strategy (e.g.
    for packaged scripts).

data.title: Fixed usage of deprecated GLSL function texture2DLod.
data.body: It is now textureLod and textureLodOffset. Error message was: (0(857) : error C7616: global function texture2DLod is removed after version 140)

data.title: Migrate Android build system to Gradle Kotlin DSL
data.body: The last Android CI build last night failed due to broken Ant build script. Our Android CI build was fine with SDK Tools version 24.0.2. The diff of `build.xml` between these two versions shows that a few Ant properties are not being defined anymore. One of them is for `aapk` which resulting in Ant build script to look for `aapk` in a wrong directory in the last CI build.

data.title: Urho2D AnimatedSprite2D + ParticleEffect2D issue
data.body:
Adding a ParticleEffect2D wrecks rendering of AnimatedSprite2D (maybe blending?).

Steps to reproduce:
In sample 33_Urho2DSpriterAnimation.lua, add these lines at the end of CreateScene():

``` lua
    local particleNode = scene_:CreateChild("Emitter")
    local particleEmitter = particleNode:CreateComponent("ParticleEmitter2D")
    particleEmitter.effect = cache:GetResource("ParticleEffect2D", "Urho2D/sun.pex")
    particleNode:Remove()
```

Note:
- worked fine with 1.32
- tested with OpenGL only

Not related, I also noticed that the looping animations no longer 'transition' smoothly ('transition' between end and start).

data.title: DrawDebugGeometry() + FXAA2 issue
data.body:
When enabling FXAA2, debug geometry becomes weird (only a few pixels are drawn).

Steps to reproduce:
In sample 11_Physics - SetupViewport(), add FXAA2 (borrowing code from sample 09) and press space to toggle debug draw:

``` lua
    local effectRenderPath = viewport:GetRenderPath():Clone()
    effectRenderPath:Append(cache:GetResource("XMLFile", "PostProcess/Bloom.xml"))
    effectRenderPath:Append(cache:GetResource("XMLFile", "PostProcess/FXAA2.xml"))
    effectRenderPath:SetEnabled("Bloom", true)
    effectRenderPath:SetEnabled("FXAA2", true)
    viewport:SetRenderPath(effectRenderPath)
```

Note that:
- it worked fine in 1.32
- tested with OpenGL only

data.title: d3dcompiler_47.dll not installed
data.body:
Urho3d samples all fail after installation on Windows 7.  Says D3DCOMPILER_47.dll is missing.  Samples run just fine from within VS2013, starting a debug with the various projects in the solution.  Selecting URHO3D_STATIC_RUNTIME in CMake and doing a clean build and install does not solve the problem.  Seems it isn't meant to eliminate all .dll dependencies.

Windows 7 and 8.0 do not ship with this dll for some reason.  Has to do with DirectX being folded into the Windows SDK and not existing separately anymore.  Apparently installing a DirectX redistributable isn't what one does anymore either.  http://blogs.msdn.com/b/chuckw/archive/2012/05/07/hlsl-fxc-and-d3dcompile.aspx says, "With the Windows 8.0 SDK, the D3DCompile DLL is never installed to the %WINDIR% folders. Instead, you should copy it into your applications folder and deploy it 'application local' with your Win32 desktop application."

data.title: Fix lightmap texture imports - likely copy-paste error

data.body:
Im using mingw and creating codeblocks compilation of the engine which compiled just fine 
now i try to create new project out of the engine source tree .
i followed the instructions  :http://urho3d.github.io/documentation/1.4/_using_library.html

```
G:\dev\cpp\3d\Urho3D\git\Urho3D-Project>ls -1

CMakeFiles
CMakeLists.txt
CoreData
Data
HelloWorld.cpp
HelloWorld.h
License.txt
cmake_codeblocks.bat
cmake_generic.bat

```

then created the CMakeLists.txt

```
# Set project name
project (Urho3D_Project_1)
# Set minimum version
cmake_minimum_required (VERSION 2.8.6)
if (COMMAND cmake_policy)
    cmake_policy (SET CMP0003 NEW)
    if (CMAKE_VERSION VERSION_GREATER 2.8.12 OR CMAKE_VERSION VERSION_EQUAL 2.8.12)
        # INTERFACE_LINK_LIBRARIES defines the link interface
        cmake_policy (SET CMP0022 NEW)
    endif ()
    if (CMAKE_VERSION VERSION_GREATER 3.0.0 OR CMAKE_VERSION VERSION_EQUAL 3.0.0)
        # Disallow use of the LOCATION target property - therefore we set to OLD as we still need it
        cmake_policy (SET CMP0026 OLD)
        # MACOSX_RPATH is enabled by default
        cmake_policy (SET CMP0042 NEW)
    endif ()
endif ()
# Set CMake modules search path
set (CMAKE_MODULE_PATH ${CMAKE_SOURCE_DIR}/CMake/Modules)
# Include Urho3D Cmake common module
include (Urho3D-CMake-common)
# Find Urho3D library
find_package (Urho3D REQUIRED)
include_directories (${URHO3D_INCLUDE_DIRS})
# Define target name
set (TARGET_NAME Urho3D_Project_1)
# Define source files
define_source_files ()
# Setup target with resource copying
setup_main_executable ()
```

data.title: Exclude nodes with Obstacle components from navigation mesh geometry …
data.body: …collection
